API Documentation¶

hashes¶

Module for standard hash algorithms, always returning the hash in hexadecimal string format.

simplecrypto.hashes.hash(message)¶

Returns the hexadecimal representation of the SHA1 hash digest.

simplecrypto.hashes.md5(message)[source]¶

Returns the hexadecimal representation of the MD5 hash digest.

simplecrypto.hashes.sha1(message)[source]¶

Returns the hexadecimal representation of the SHA1 hash digest.

simplecrypto.hashes.sha256(message)[source]¶

Returns the hexadecimal representation of the SHA256 hash digest.

simplecrypto.hashes.sha512(message)[source]¶

Returns the hexadecimal representation of the SHA512 hash digest.

key¶

Module for cryptographic keys in general.

class simplecrypto.key.AesKey(key=None)[source]¶

Class for symmetric AES with 256 bits block size.

class simplecrypto.key.Key(algorithm_name, nbits=None, block_size=None)[source]¶

Abstract base class for all keys, symmetric or not, public or not.

Subclasses should implement encrypt_raw, decrypt_raw and serialize as necessary.

decrypt(encrypted_message)[source]¶

Decrypts the given encrypted message, converting it to bytes as required. Returns the message’s bytes.

decrypt_raw(encrypted_message)[source]¶

Decrypts the given message. encrypted_message must be of type bytes and the return is also raw bytes.

encrypt(message)[source]¶

Encrypts the given message, first converting it to raw bytes. Returns the base64 encoded encrypted message.

encrypt_raw(message)[source]¶

Encrypts the given message. message must be of type bytes and the return is also raw bytes.

serialize()[source]¶

Returns a bytes object representing this key.

class simplecrypto.key.RsaKeypair(source=2048)[source]¶

Class for asymmetric RSA keypair.

class simplecrypto.key.RsaPublicKey(key)[source]¶

Class for asymmetric public RSA key.

simplecrypto.key.decrypt(encrypted_message, key)[source]¶

Shortcut for AES256 base64 decryption with string or bytes key.

simplecrypto.key.encrypt(message, key)[source]¶

Shortcut for AES256 base64 encryption with string or bytes key.

simplecrypto.key.receive(payload, recipient_key, sender_key)[source]¶

Receives a secure message from a binary payload.

simplecrypto.key.send(message, sender_key, *recipient_keys)[source]¶

Sends a secure message to one or more recipients. The message is encrypted with the recipient’s key (so only they can read it), and signed with the sender’s key (so the recipient can check the authenticity and integrity).

Returns the binary payload.

simplecrypto.key.session_decrypt_raw(encrypted_message, destination_key)[source]¶

Decrypts the message from a random session key, encrypted with the destination key.

Superior alternative when the destination key is slow (ex RSA).

simplecrypto.key.session_encrypt_raw(message, destination_key)[source]¶

Encrypts the message with a random session key, and protects this session key by encrypting with the destination key.

Superior alternative when the destination key is slow (ex RSA).

formats¶

Module for conversion between different formats, such as base64, hex, bytes and utf-8.

simplecrypto.formats.base64(message)¶

Returns the base64 representation of a string or bytes.

simplecrypto.formats.from_base64(message)[source]¶

Returns the bytes from a base64 representation.

simplecrypto.formats.from_hex(message)[source]¶

Returns the bytes from a (string) hexadecimal representation.

simplecrypto.formats.hex(message)¶

Returns the (string) hexadecimal representation of a string or bytes.

simplecrypto.formats.pad(message, length, padding=b'\x00')[source]¶

Pads a message with binary zeroes until a given length is reached.

simplecrypto.formats.pad_multiple(message, len_multiple, padding=b'\x00')[source]¶

Pads a message with binary zeroes until the length is a desired multiple.

simplecrypto.formats.to_base64(message)[source]¶

Returns the base64 representation of a string or bytes.

simplecrypto.formats.to_bytes(message)[source]¶

Returns the bytes representation of an arbitrary message.

simplecrypto.formats.to_hex(message)[source]¶

Returns the (string) hexadecimal representation of a string or bytes.

simplecrypto.formats.to_str(message)[source]¶

Returns the string representation of an arbitrary message.

random¶

Module for retrieving cryptographically random values.

simplecrypto.random.random(n_bytes)[source]¶

Returns n_bytes of cryptographically secure random bytes.

guess¶

Module for reverse engineering crypto protocols.

simplecrypto.guess.guess_transformation(message, hash_value)[source]¶

Given a message and its known value, returns the list of hash or modifiers functions applied to the message to arrive at the given hash_value.

Useful for reverse engineering protocols or stored values.

exceptions¶
